reviews.review: Something to watch and kill time even recognizing some famous voices like James Corden and Sofia from modern family not as bad as what people say. I think its great for when you are bored and feeling "meh" and is looking for something to watch!

This was the greatest movie of all time. The store line is suspenseful and amazing. The entire movie I was sitting on the edge of my chair, wonder what would happen next. I give this movie a 100 emoji out of ten.
I'm sad I couldn't give this movie 0/5 stars. There is nothing good about this movie.

For the full review, click my timeline on Facebook. But for the quick review, i love The Emoji Movie. It is really good despite that a hatebase was evolved after the film came out. Trust me, i hate the hatebase for this film. Overall, i loved it and i will still enjoy it like Inside Out. Do not go against me for loving a movie that they criticize.
Yeah. It's about as bad as everyone says it is.
I liked it! It deserves better rating and better review. I also think that the reviews are really harsh.
DUMB. WORST FILM EVER. BAD CHOICE T.J. MILLER YOU MADE BETTER FILMS AND NOW IT SEEMS U R DESPERATE FOR MONEY.

Lets start with the negatives,

1. It's called the Emoji movie
2. It's called the Emoji movie

I'm so sorry to end on a bad note so lets see the psitives,



That's my review.

Worst piece of animation ive seen from a major company. Hell, ive seen first time  animated companies make better movies. No heart or soul in this film. Mediocre voice acting. Animation was nice it self but ive seen similar if not BETTER in movies like Cloudy With A Chance Of Meatballs and the short film In a Heartbeat. Story line was bland. Never will watch again. If How To Train Your Dragon 2 could make me feel things and even make me cry there is no excuse for the Emoji movie.

excellent movie! 
it was funny, cute, interesting and delivered a great message.
the animation should at least get 80% 
nonetheless, it offers great values for kids such as 'being yourself','helping out others', and expressing one's own opinion instead of conforming to the crowd.
